work.name: Dynamic Graphics Project Lab
work.summary: Machine Learning, Generative Modeling, Computer vision, Pytorch
highlights: Working with Prof. Kyros Kutulakos and Prof. David Lindell on a computer vision project, regarding a new patch-based image representation via generative modeling.
Implemented some image to image translation applications based on our newly developed image representation scheme, such as single image super-resolution, image denoising, etc.
Familiarized modern deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, developed the writing, presentation, and communication skills along the way.

courses: Courses: Deep Learning and Neural Network (CSC413), Probabilistic Machine Learning (CSC412), Intro to Machine Learning (CSC311), Visual Computing (CSC320), Computer Graphics (CSC317), Advanced Probability (STA347), Statistics (STA261), Multivariable Calc (MAT237), Linear Algebra (MAT224)

awards.title: Nora Kathleen Gillies Scholarship Fund
awards.summary: Scholarship amounts to $300, awarded by Woodworth College, University of Toronto, to whom has achieved acdemic excellence

awards.title: Alexander T. Fulton: Computer Science
awards.summary: Scholarship amounts to $400, awarded to an outstanding student who has completed the first year in the Faculty of Arts and Science and who is enrolled in a Computer Science program.
